intro: Oxyspora senguptae, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves and small greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Oxyspora senguptae is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause irritation upon contact with the skin.
